summary:
Aluminum is a common metal with the symbol Al. It is lightweight, about one-third the density of steel, and has a silver-like appearance. When exposed to air, it forms a protective oxide layer. Aluminum is soft, non-magnetic, and can be easily shaped.

Found mostly in rocks, aluminum is the third most abundant element in Earth's crust. People first made aluminum in 1825, and it's now widely used in many products, like planes, cars, and cans. It's also safe for plants and animals. Scientists are still studying if aluminum has any use in living things.
title: Aluminium
